subject: Re: [junit] Re: How do I set the testcase name dynamically with using 	junit4?
msgSnippet: A release soon.  We have a fix for a serious problem with Categories and the even-more-popular ClassRule close to ready to go, so we might go ahead and release
messageBody:
A release soon. We have a fix for a serious problem with Categories
and the even-more-popular ClassRule close to ready to go, so we might
go ahead and release that as 4.9, and pick this up as part of 4.10.
Thanks,

David

On Tue, May 25, 2010 at 5:55 AM, zx200287853714
<zx200287853714@...> wrote:
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>>
>> Tao,
>>
>> There's nothing good for this right now.  However, better naming of
>> Parameterized tests is very high in the feature-request voting right
>> now (http://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues#issue/44), so I imagine
>> this will change soon.
>>
>>    David Saff
>
> That's good to know, also I see some great guys have already posted their patch for that. So can I assume that this feature will be supported in the next release?
>
> My project hangs on this issue, so we have to stay on Junit3.8.1.....
>
> Thanks and regards!
> Tao
>
>
